definition: to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)
to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

sentences.english: We can call it a visit.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以把這稱作一次省親。

sentences.english: Visiting parents poetry before the Tang Dynasty expresses home complex of personal homesickness.
sentences.chinese: 唐前省親詩僅表達了個人思歸的家園情結。

sentences.english: A special cake , called the mothering cake, was often brought along to provide a festive touch.
sentences.chinese: 他們帶回的特別的省親蛋糕增添了節日的氣氛。

sentences.english: Visting parents is an etiquette to pay filial homage to parents.
sentences.chinese: 省親是歸家探望父母的禮俗。

sentences.english: According to the regulations concerned, he has only a couple of weeks (more than ten days) every four years to visit his relatives.
sentences.chinese: 期間按規定每四年纔能有十多天的時間回老家省親。

sentences.english: With every homecoming, there is also a farewell.
sentences.chinese: 每次省親回家但終究是要說聲再見。

sentences.english: Every year I used to arrange the schedule to go home while spend vacation by the way.
sentences.chinese: 以往我每年必須找一個假期，回家省親，順便度假。
